title: My life on the front line as a Met Police murder investigator in London's bloodiest year
text:
When the murder of Kwabena “Kobi” Nelson landed on my desk back in February 2018, it made for difficult reading. As lead of a Met Police homicide investigation unit, I read of how the 22-year-old youth worker from Tottenham, who helped others turn their lives around, saw his Honda Civic rammed by attackers before he was kicked and stabbed 14 times.

The file came with a harrowing tape of the 999 call featuring Kobi’s final words: “I got stabbed… I’m dead… I’m dead.” He died at the scene, his brother crying over him.

Six weeks later, I was given a second case: Kelvin Odunuyi had been shot outside a Wood Green cinema in the first fatal shooting of 2018. He was 19 and caught in the middle of a “postcode...
description: When the murder of Kwabena “Kobi” Nelson landed on my desk back in February 2018, it made for difficult reading.
